The Price-Anderson Amendments Act of 2003 extends indemnification authority for nuclear regulatory commission licensees, Department of Energy contractors, and nonprofit educational institutions until August 1, 2017. The Price-Anderson Amendments Act of 2003 extends indemnification authority for nuclear regulatory commission licensees, Department of Energy contractors, and nonprofit educational institutions until August 1, 2017. Section 170 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 is amended to increase the maximum assessment to $94,000,000 and $15,000,000 in any 1 year, effective July 1, 2002. The Atomic Energy Act of 1954 is amended to allow the Department of Energy contractors to provide financial protection for public liability, with the Secretary indemnifying them for liability above $10,000,000,000. The Atomic Energy Act of 1954 is amended to provide indemnification for contractors in connection with nuclear incidents, with the Secretary approving legal costs. Contract amendments and liability limits are also addressed in the amendments. The Atomic Energy Act of 1954 is amended to provide indemnification for contractors in connection with nuclear incidents, with the Secretary approving legal costs. Contract amendments and liability limits are also addressed in the amendments, including adjustments to the maximum financial protection required. SEC. 5. INCIDENTS OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES.

Amends the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 to increase the amount of indemnification and liability limit to $500,000,000.

SEC. 6. REPORTS.

Amends the reporting deadline in the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 to August 1, 2013.

SEC. 7. INFLATION ADJUSTMENT. SEC. 7. INFLATION ADJUSTMENT.

Amends the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 to adjust indemnification amounts every 5 years based on the Consumer Price Index. SEC. 8. TREATMENT OF MODULAR REACTORS.

Amends the Atomic Energy Act to consider a combination of facilities as a single facility with a rated capacity of 100,000 electrical kilowatts or more. 

SEC. 9. APPLICABILITY.

The amendments made by sections 3, 4, and 5 do not apply to nuclear incidents before the enactment of this Act.

SEC. 10. CIVIL PENALTIES. Amendment to the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 regarding the repeal of automatic remission and limitation for not-for-profit institutions. The total amount of civil penalties for not-for-profit contractors, subcontractors, or suppliers cannot exceed the total fees paid within a one-year period under the contract where the violation occurs. The term 'not-for-profit' means that earnings do not benefit any natural person or for-profit entity. The amendments made by this section regarding the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 do not apply to violations occurring under contracts entered into before the enactment of this section.
